resources.string: This app features calculators for color-band inductors, capable of converting between color to value and value to color and SMD inductors.
This app follows the IEC 60062 international standard for inductor coding and calculations to help ensure accuracy.
The inductor color code uses colored bands to indicate inductance values and tolerance. This system allows for easy identification of inductor values in a compact format.
Each color corresponds to a specific value, depending on its position on the inductor. The standard colors and their corresponding values are displayed in the table below.
Four-band inductors have two significant figure bands, one multiplier band, and one tolerance band.

Some inductors have five bands. If the first band is a double-length silver band, it indicates that the inductor uses military standards. Please note that this app does not support five-band inductors.

The information provided here regarding IEC standards is intended for general guidance. Please note that not all components may strictly adhere to these standards, as manufacturers may have variations or different interpretations. Always consult the specific datasheet or contact the manufacturer directly if you are unsure about the specifications or standards for a particular component.

The IEC 60062 standard defines alphanumeric markings for inductors, allowing manufacturers to label inductance values in a compact format. This is ideal for smaller components like SMD (Surface-Mount Device) inductors.
In this system, inductors often use a three-digit code, with an optional letter for tolerance.
